page.title: 03Historic Buildings.
page.content: Eltham Palace. Much of Eltham Palace was built by the Bishop of Durham around 1300.When he died it passed into the hands of the monarchy.The palace enjoyed great popularity during the Plantagenet period.In 1479 Edward 4 constructed a replacement for the original great hall which had been destroyed,and a few years later Henry 7 built the stone moat-bridge which is extant today. However during the Tudor period it fell into disuse except for occasional Royal hunting trips.By the seventeenth centuary it was in private hands and had become virtually uninhabitable.It was used as a barn and fell into ruins despite repair work.In 1933 the Courtaul family extensively renovated the hall and built an extension adjacent to it.This is at present occupied by the Royal Army Educational
